sentences.sContent: The performance of the clown kept the public rolling about.
sentences.sContent_eng: The performance of the clown kept the public rolling about.
sentences.sCn: 小丑的表演使观众笑得前仰后合。

sentences.sContent: When she learned how to do this, I was ready to let her step over a clown.
sentences.sContent_eng: When she learned how to do this, I was ready to let her step over a clown.
sentences.sCn: 当她学习了该如何做这的时候,我准备好让在一个小丑上的她步骤.

sentences.sContent: He will go to clown school.

synos.tran: 小丑；乡下人；粗鲁笨拙的人

trans.tranOther: someone who wears funny clothes, a red nose, bright  make-up  on their face etc, and does silly things to make people laugh, especially at a  circus
